awd_titl_txt: Travel: Student Travel Grant for the 2023 ACM SIGMETRICS International Conference on Measurement and Modeling of Computer Systems
awd_abstract_narration:
The ACM Sigmetrics 2023 conference will be held at the Orlando World Marriott in Orlando, Florida, USA between June 19–23, 2023. Sigmetrics 2023 will be part of the ACM Federated Computing Research Conference (FCRC) 2023, and will thus be colocated with other leading conferences in other communities including ISCA 2023, STOC 2023, PODC 2023, SPAA 2023, and PLDI 2023.The SIGMETRICS conference is primarily focusing on the performance analysis, measurement, and modeling of networked computer systems. ACM SIGMETRICS 2023 aims to provide a high-quality forum for presenting results and discussing ideas that further our knowledge and understanding of the measurement, modeling, analysis, and design of computing and networked systems. The conference interprets computer systems broadly, including traditional computing systems as well as social networks, data networks, and other types of systems. Contributions containing highly original ideas, new approaches, and/or ground-breaking results are particularly encouraged.

This grant provides travel support for about 25 US based students to attend the SIGMETRICS 2023 conference. The support will make possible the participation of students who would otherwise be unable to attend the conference. Particular attention will be paid to directing support towards various underrepresented population. SIGMETRICS brings together professionals from a wide variety of academic and industrial backgrounds; student participants will thus get the opportunity to interact with mentors and peers of varying gender, ethnicity, and background. Students will also benefit from the student-centric events, including a student workshop/panel and a student research competition.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Computer and Information Science and Engineering
org_div_long_name: Division Of Computer and Network Systems

por.por_cntn:
SIGMETRICS is the Association for Computing Machinery's (ACM) Special Interest Group (SIG) for the computer performance evaluation community; it holds an annual conference by the same name focused on performance modeling, measurement, and analysis of computer systems. The SIGMETRICS 2023 conference was located in Orlando, Florida from June 19-22, 2023, and co-located with the ACM Federated Computing Research Conference (FCRC), a jointly-hosted set of ACM conferences including (but not limited to) International Symposium on Computer Architecture (ISCA), Programming Language Design and Implementation (PLDI), Symposium on Principles of Distributed Computing (PODC), and SIGMETRICS. 

The SIGMETRICS 2023 Student Travel Grant supported 25 students studying at U.S. universities to attend the conference. In doing so, it fostered intellectual merit and broader impacts within the field. 

Intellectual Merit

The grant enhanced the intellectual merit of the conference by facilitating the participation of 25 students. 

Four of the supported students participated in the second annual SIGMETRICS Student Research Competition (SRC). The SRC not only provided a platform for these students to present their work but also allowed them to receive constructive feedback from experienced researchers, further elevating the intellectual rigor of their projects. These projects spanned many topics, including new analysis techniques for queueing theory, an empirical analysis of neural networks, and tools for private blockchain usage. Three of the four Student Travel Grantees who participated in the SRC won an award, including one undergraduate student. 

Additionally, 12 of the supported students presented papers either at workshops or the main conference. These presentations covered a diverse range of topics, highlighting the grant's success in promoting intellectual diversity. The presentations not only showcased the students' contributions to the field but also stimulated discussions and collaborations among conference attendees. Two of the awardees won best paper awards at the conference (Best Paper and Best Student Paper). 

The intellectual merit of the grant is further demonstrated by the active participation of the attendees in various sessions, workshops, and community events. Engaging with leading researchers and academics at these events provided the students with valuable insights, fostering intellectual growth and expanding their understanding of the latest advancements in their respective fields.

Broader Impacts

The SIGMETRICS 2023 Student Travel Grant helped to encourage broader participation in the SIGMETRICS community. The grant supported conference travel costs for seven non-male students (28% of the awardees) and one student from an under-represented racial minority (4% of awardees). The supported students came from a diverse set of universities and research groups, both in terms of research area (theory, measurement, systems, and learning) and in terms of university size, geographic location, and focus. The grantees also included two undergraduate students (8%) and two Master’s students (8%). The remaining 21 students were pursuing Ph.D.s at the time of the conference. 

Several student grantees, particularly those on the job market, utilized the conference as a platform to network and disseminate their work. The opportunity to connect with established researchers, industry professionals, and peers has the potential to open doors for future collaborations, research opportunities, and career advancements.

The grant's support for students presenting papers at workshops or the main conference not only contributed to the academic discourse within the conference but also allowed the students to share their research findings with a wider audience, due to the conference’s co-location with FCRC.

Conclusion

The Sigmetrics 2023 Student Travel Grant successfully contributed to both the intellectual merit and broader impacts of the conference. By supporting a diverse group of students, fostering high-quality research, and providing opportunities for networking and knowledge dissemination, the grant played an important role in advancing the fields of performance modeling, measurement, and analysis of computer systems. 

 

 

 


Last Modified: 01/04/2024
Modified by: Giulia Fanti
